communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Flock Camera Usage
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

The Data related to the Village of Niles, or Niles Police Department, has accumulated with Flock Safety.

The scope of this request includes the following:

1. Contracts between the Village of Niles / Niles Police Department and Flock.
2. Relevant Minutes from City Hall that approved the contracts.
3. Current policy related to the use of Flock cameras
4. Current policy related to the limits of use of Flock cameras
5. Amount of monthly uses of Flock camera searches by Niles Police Department from time of camera installation.
6. Amount of monthly "hotlist" hits/alerts that Flock generates.
7. Amount of monthly times Flock has led to successful citations or arrests.

Please note: I am NOT asking for any identifiable information of civilians or ongoing cases

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Zeke Martin

communications.communication:

Please note: : I am NOT asking for any identifiable information of civilians or ongoing cases

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
